definition: variant of 御[yu4]/to drive/to manage/to control

sentences.english: The days when European empires dominated the globe had gone.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲帝国统驭全球的时代早已远去。

sentences.english: The bipolarity is the universal natural definition, dominating all the physical evolvements .
sentences.chinese: 两极性是宇宙的自然定义，统驭一切物理演化。

sentences.english: All secret powers of nature are at your command.
sentences.chinese: 您统驭着大自然的一切神秘之力。

definition: to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
to assume full responsibility/to be in full control/to monopolize
to overawe/to be scared into submission
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
as the arm moves the finger (idiom)/freely and effortlessly/to have perfect command of
in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
